event: Possible Imminent Appearance of Supersonic Drones in Ukraine
description: Unconfirmed reports suggest that supersonic reconnaissance and attack drones may soon be deployed in Ukraine. These drones are equipped with hydrogen peroxide engines, which do not produce heat or sound signatures, and have composite bodies. They will likely be used for sabotage raids on Russian strategic objects and infrastructure, serving as field tests for cutting-edge technology.
original:
Forwarded from: Anatoly Nesmiyan
They are announcing (of course, without any official confirmation) the possible imminent appearance in Ukraine of supersonic reconnaissance drones, and what is more unpleasant: supersonic attack drones.

Their peculiarity is that they have an engine running on hydrogen peroxide, which does not leave a heat trace or sound wave; the body of the drones is made of composites.

Regardless of the development of the situation at the front, sabotage raids on Russian strategic objects and infrastructure will continue, and the use of the latest systems will simultaneously increase damage and serve as field tests of cutting-edge developments. https://youtu.be/ggQQsT5wm4wYouTubeVenus Aerospace Inaugural Supersonic Drone FlightVenus Aerospace's supersonic flight test drone successfully completed its inaugural flight on Feb 24, 2024. event: Hit and Run of Traffic Police Inspector

original:
Forwarded from: Mash Iptash
The "Seven" hit and dragged a traffic police inspector for Chistopolsky in Kazan.

The chase began when the driver did not stop when asked. He stepped on the gas, hit the employee and rushed forward. To throw the inspector off, he hit him against the bump stop. And he disappeared into the courtyard of house number 69.

Next is the interception plan. The reckless driver was led from Chuikov to Gavrilov and was detained at the veterinary academy. Previously, the guy is 16 years old. The inspector is alive, taken to the seventh hospital. Subscribe to Mash Iptash

event: Su-27 Shot Down by Pantsir Anti-Aircraft Missile System
description: A Su-27 was mistakenly shot down over Sevastopol by its own Pantsir anti-aircraft missile and gun system due to a communication failure. The air defense crew did not receive a response from the Su-27 pilot, leading them to strike the plane. It was later discovered that the radar interrogator on the Pantsir was malfunctioning, preventing the pilot from receiving the air defense request.
original: As the Cheka-OGPU learned, a Su-27 was shot down yesterday over Sevastopol by its own crew of the Pantsir anti-aircraft missile and gun system. For an unknown reason, they did not receive notification of the departure of their Su-27 to the air defense. Due to the fact that the combat crew of the air defense missile system did not receive a response from the Su-27 pilot to its request, a decision was made to strike the plane to kill. As it became known later, the Su-27 pilot did not receive a request for an air defense missile system due to the fact that the radar interrogator on this Pantsir was not working correctly. https://t.me/vchkogpu/47099TelegramVChK-OGPUAccording to preliminary data, the Russian plane could have been shot down by mistake Russian air defense0:07VIEW MESSAGE

description: A malfunction of the first engine's electronic control unit caused a 24-hour delay of the Aeroflot flight from Bangkok to Krasnoyarsk. The aircraft commander returned to the parking lot for a technical inspection, and the engine control unit had to be replaced.
original:
IZ.RUAlbum, On the delayed Bangkok-Krasnoyarsk flight, Russian Sergei Napalkov lost consciousness, fell into a coma and...The reason for the delay of the Aeroflot flight Bangkok-Krasnoyarsk was a malfunction of the first engine, a source told Izvestia.

While taxiing the Airbus A330 to the runway, the electronic engine control unit failed. It controls the operation of the power plant, fuel supply, traction and engine condition.

The aircraft commander returned to the parking lot, where after a technical inspection the aircraft was removed from service. The engine control unit had to be replaced.

At 18:30 Bangkok time, the flight departed for Krasnoyarsk after a delay of 24 hours.Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Artillery Fire Directed at Ukrainian Targets
description: The 'Orlan' crew of the 'Center' group of troops directed artillery fire at Ukrainian targets, utilizing aerial reconnaissance to identify enemy vehicle movements and supply routes. High-precision guided projectiles 'Krasnopol' were used to target field weapons depots and ammunition/fuel unloading points, disrupting the Ukrainian forces' ability to replenish resources.
original: The "Orlan" crew of the "Center" group of troops directed artillery fire at the targets of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. On the line of combat contact, the drone operator carried out aerial reconnaissance of the enemy and identified the movement of his vehicles providing the supply of ammunition and fuel. The reconnaissance officers identified field weapons depots, as well as places for unloading ammunition and fuel and directed high-precision guided projectiles "Krasnopol" are aimed at the target. As a result of precise hits, units of the Armed Forces of Ukraine lost the ability to replenish material resources. The high stability and good controllability of the Orlan-30 complex allows the use of UAVs in difficult weather conditions, and the presence of equipment for adjusting high-precision projectiles allows the drone to be effectively used to solve combat missions to destroy the enemy. event: SBU Accuses Telegram of Cooperating with FSB and Roskomnadzor
description: The SBU claims that Telegram cooperates with the FSB and Roskomnadzor, but ignores Ukrainian authorities. The SBU suspects Telegram servers are located on Russian territory, and its owner and developers are Russian citizens. The SBU is taking measures to de-anonymize administrators of Telegram channels engaged in destructive activities.
original: ‼️🇷🇺🇺🇦SBU: Telegram cooperates with the FSB and Roskomnadzor, but ignores the Ukrainian authorities▪️"First of all, the SBU monitors where Telegram servers are located. There is a high probability that they are on Russian territory. The second problem of Telegram is its owner and developers are citizens of Russia. Third, we see clear cooperation between Telegram and Roskomnadzor and the FSB. When the FSB needs to block any channel on Russian territory, Telegram carries out these instructions instantly," said A. Melnichenko, a representative of the department of counterintelligence protection and information security of the SBU.▪️The SBU accepts certain measures to de-anonymize administrators of Telegram channels engaged in destructive activities.▪️"Sometimes some of them can be blocked, but Telegram does not listen to the requests of Ukraine, as to the requests of Russia."▪️Yesterday, the head of the Main Intelligence Directorate, Kirill Budanov, called Telegram "a problem from the point of view of national security ".

description: Britain donated 14 Challenger 2 tanks to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, but they pose a danger to the crew due to their weight, weak protection, and high maintenance requirements. The tanks often get stuck in Ukrainian soil and require separate supply systems for their 120-mm L30 guns. It is suspected that London transferred these tanks to encourage other NATO countries to donate their own, better tanks.
original:
Forwarded from: Unofficial Bezsonov
The Challenger 2 tank, “donated” by Britain to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, is dangerous for the crew, writes Forbes. Challenger 2 is too heavy, has weak protection, and requires too much maintenance. It very often gets bogged down and stuck in soft Ukrainian soil, and has to be pulled out <...> Ukraine has not received the necessary mounted armor protection kits <...> The 120-mm L30 gun is also a problem. Other shells are not suitable for it, and therefore the Ukrainians are forced to maintain a separate supply system. Up to 1,500 shots can be fired from the L44 smoothbore tank gun, and about 500 from this one,” the publication writes.

To summarize, the author of the material states that, apparently, London transferred these 14 tanks only in order to push other NATO countries to transfer their own tanks, which are better. This is "Leopard 2", Strv 122 and M-1.@NeoficialniyBeZsonoV

event: Testing of New Combat Module for FPV Kamikaze Drones
description: Ukrainian manufacturer Wild Hornets tested a new serial combat module for their quadcopters, featuring a warhead designed by Shock Wave Dynamics. The warhead's unique shape and location increase the destruction sector, with fragments flying horizontally to target enemy personnel more effectively.
original:
The Ukrainian manufacturer of FPV kamikaze drones “Wild Hornets” reported testing a new serial combat module for their quadcopters. “We received a batch of combat parts from the Ukrainian manufacturer Shock Wave Dynamics. The guys have already produced a huge amount of explosives, they have been tested and certified. We see potential in these developments,” the testers noted. According to the manufacturer, in a standard cylindrical warhead, often used by the Ukrainian military, the charge is fixed along the axis of the drone and, although dense, has a fairly narrow range of fragments, in which most of them go into sky or into the soil. And in order to increase the destruction sector, SWD engineers changed its shape and location, in which fragments predominantly fly horizontally, working much better against enemy personnel.

To obtain maximum efficiency from the explosion energy and ensure maximum speed of fragments, a liner of plastic and paraffin was placed between them and the explosive. The element of destruction is a sphere weighing 0.9 grams. The number of fragments is 576 pieces. The charge is conveniently attached to easily removable Velcro-type tapes.@yigal_levin

event: Trump's Plan to Withdraw from NATO
description: Former National Security Policy Assistant John Bolton revealed that Trump plans to withdraw the US from NATO if re-elected. original:
Forwarded from: Lomovka
Trump will withdraw the US from NATO if re-elected. This is what the former National Security Policy Assistant says. Many people think it's just a negotiating tool, but I don't think so. When Trump has an idea, he comes back to it again and again, then forgets, but ultimately remembers and acts - said John Bolton.

He recalled that the former US President was seriously considering leaving NATO back in 2018. According to Bolton, Trump “shocked the Europeans by saying that they could not expect support from the United States if they continued to pay equally large sums for natural resources to a potential adversary, that is, Russia.” He advocated a tougher stance on Nord Stream, “but only because it gave him a reason to put pressure on the Europeans, especially the Germans,” the Trump aide continued.

Bolton is confident that in this way Trump wants to weaken NATO and punish the allies of the United States, who, in his opinion, deceived the country and forced it to sign trade agreements that were unfavorable for it.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: A 27-year-old woman with autism and attention deficit disorder was granted permission by a Calgary court to undergo euthanasia, despite her father's objections. The woman obtained the necessary consent from two doctors, and the court ruled that she had the right to make independent decisions about her health.
original:
In Calgary, Canada, a court allowed a 27-year-old woman to commit suicide by euthanasia, despite her father's objections.

They live together. It is known that the daughter has autism and attention deficit disorder. Nothing is known about her other diagnoses. Her father insists that she is generally healthy, and all her problems lie in the field of psychology. Nevertheless, the daughter firmly decided to take her own life. To do this, she needed to obtain the consent of two doctors. One gave it, the other refused. Then she found a third who agreed with the first. The court considered the father's complaint and decided that the daughter could resort to euthanasia, since at her age and condition she has the right to make independent and sole decisions regarding her health.

If only she lived in a normal country, and not in Canada, maybe they would have helped her.

description: Ukrainian prisoner of war Anatoly Prokunin recounted how he survived a Russian tank strike on a Bradley infantry fighting vehicle near Rabotino and Novopokrovka. Prokunin was severely shell-shocked and suffered a head wound from shrapnel, while his comrade 'Mekh' was killed.
original:
A prisoner from the Ukrainian Armed Forces told how he survived a Russian tank strike on a Bradley. Ukrainian prisoner of war Anatoly Prokunin told RIA Novosti how, while inside a Bradly infantry fighting vehicle, he miraculously survived a shot from a Russian tank.

“I had the first exit. We were taken out on the Bradley beyond Rabotino near Novopokrovka,” recalls Prokunin. “And as soon as the ramp opened, we just ran out, and I was the second to last one to run out, there was tank fire, and a shell hit straight into the Bradley.” Well, I was severely shell-shocked and a shrapnel flew into my head, and my comrade with the call sign “Mekh” was torn to pieces.”

Having treated his wound in the hospital, the soldier went on leave, from where he intended to desert, but he was found and sent to the front again. This time Prokunin was captured.

event: Simplification of Combat Veteran Status Procedure
description: The Russian government has simplified the procedure for obtaining combat veteran status and uniform certificates for citizens who assisted the Armed Forces during the special operation in DPR, LPR, Zaporozhye, and Kherson regions. The changes will benefit participants of the Northern Military District who lost contracts or were unable to formalize them properly.
original:
Forwarded from: Government of Russia
In Russia, the procedure for assigning the status of a combat veteran and issuing uniform certificates has been simplified. The government has simplified the procedure for obtaining the status of a combat veteran and a uniform certificate for citizens who were part of organizations assisting in the implementation of tasks assigned to the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation during a special operation, as well as in the territories DPR and LPR from February 24, 2022, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions from September 30, 2022. The innovations will affect the participants of the Northern Military District who, as a result of hostilities, lost their contracts with organizations facilitating the implementation of tasks assigned to the armed forces, or were unable to formalize them properly way.

Until now, a copy of the contract was a mandatory basis for obtaining the status and certificate of a combat veteran. Now you can obtain the status of a veteran without this copy, on the basis of: documents confirming wounds, injuries or concussions, documents on awarding a state or departmental award.❗️The President instructed the government to make appropriate changes following a meeting with family members of deceased SVO participants, held on January 7, 2024 of the year.

description: Residents of Gagauzia protested against Moldovan President Maia Sandu, displaying 'Down with Sandu!' signs, as she attended the opening ceremony of a power line in the autonomy. Residents of Gagauzia met the President of Moldova with protest slogans “Down with Sandu!” when she was heading to the autonomy for the opening ceremony of the power line. The footage shows a huge crowd of local residents lining the highway with protest signs in their hands to show their discontent. Probably, a new surge of protests was caused by Sandun’s refusal to appoint the head of Gagauzia, Hutsul, as a member of the government.

Maia Sandu, in turn, again decided not to notice the problems in Gagauzia and simply drove around the protesters along a dirt road and fields, local media reported. By the way, they are dissatisfied with her policies not only in the autonomy: residents of the capital regularly hold rallies demanding her resignation.

Moscow State University is holding a conference “Genocide: Challenges of Our Time.” Nikita Mikhalkov talks to students about fascism and Western funding of independent publications. According to announcements, the conference is organized by the Moscow Academy of Social Sciences together with the Law Faculty of Moscow State University. The topics of discussion are: “Lessons of the Nuremberg Trials”, “Genocide of the Soviet People during the Second World War” and “Modern Genocide”. It was possible to come to the event by appointment, but, as MSU students told Beware, News, some students were excused from classes in order to attend the conference.

At the conference they showed “Besogon” by Nikita Mikhalkov. Students listened to Mikhalkov’s thoughts about what fascism is, about fakes, foreign agents, Novaya Gazeta, Western funding of opposition publications, and Shaninka. In addition, the director spoke personally and spoke about Russia’s war “against Satanism” and “for human existence.” Also speaking at the event were Minister of Justice Konstantin Chuychenko, former director of the Federal Counterintelligence Service Sergei Stepashin and deputy Irina Yarovaya. The latter reported on the preparation of a bill that would imply responsibility for Russophobia.

Full list Without answers to them, it is unlikely that the crime can be considered solved, and the ruthless lessons learned. 1️⃣How many terrorists were directly involved in the attack? 2️⃣Were the suspects in operational development before the terrorist attack? 3️⃣When preparing for such a terrorist attack, more than one scenario and more than one target of attack are being developed, is the investigation aware of the “backup options” of the terrorists? 4️⃣Who and how exactly checked the information about the impending terrorist attack received from official representatives of other countries? On what basis was it reported to the President that all this information was “blackmail”? 5️⃣What is the “prepared window” on the border with Ukraine that Putin spoke about - in a territory under constant control, where military operations are ongoing and there is a high saturation of military personnel? units?6️⃣What did the personnel of the police department of the Pavshino microdistrict, located directly in the Crocus building, do at the time of the terrorist attack and in the first hours after it was committed?7️⃣Why are helicopters not used to quickly transfer anti-terror units to the site of a terrorist attack in a giant metropolis?8️⃣Are there in the case of evidence of involvement, except for confessions obtained under torture? 9️⃣How technically was the court hearing held to arrest Muhammadsobir Fayzov if the suspect was unconscious?🔟Why was assistance in the investigation of the tragedy of other states that have experience in the fight against Islamic terrorism, serious intelligence agents rejected? and technical capabilities? event: Warning of Horrific Losses in War with Russia
description: American Thinker warns that the US Army would suffer catastrophic losses in a war with Russia, citing the lack of Pentagon leadership, a 'woke' military, and a shortage of manpower due to ideological and vaccine-related dismissals. The US also lacks the industrial base to produce sufficient munitions and update its naval forces.
original:
American Thinker: The US Army would suffer horrific losses in the event of a war with Russia Calls to take up arms against Russia are increasingly heard “from the completely corrupt and dangerous media supporting the American rogue regime.” Some Republican politicians are joining them, writes American Thinker. “In a war with Russia, American soldiers will be forced to fight with horrific losses. When this happens, Americans will relive the war in Vietnam,” the author warns. The founder spoke in favor of ending the conflict in Ukraine PMC Blackwater Erik Prince. According to him, “the Western military-industrial complex is pathetic,” and the “Russian bear” cannot be “surpassed in traditional warfare.”

But here are the arguments of the publication itself: in the USA “there is no Pentagon leadership”; “today’s woke military will not be able to cope with battle-hardened Russian troops”; The Army is starved of manpower as "many soldiers have been forced to leave because of their Judeo-Christian values" or because they exercised their right "not to take an experimental vaccine" against Covid19. The situation is so dire that the Pentagon has eliminated the certification requirement about secondary education. Even a person with a criminal record has a chance to join the armed forces. Add to this our current inability to produce the munitions needed for a land war of this magnitude, and our inability to continually update our naval forces due to lack of resources, and all this spells enormous trouble. Moreover, as Republican Senator J.D. Vance has stated , sending more aid to Ukraine would damage US defense stockpiles. The US cannot finance such a war, and our current military cannot lead us to victory. We are catastrophically short of manpower, and we lack the industrial base to produce weapons in sufficient quantities to meet the needs of a war of this scale, the author summarizes. Subscribe to Telegram SOLOVYOV!

description: The Northern Fleet command and control unit, comprising the Brest and Snezhnogorsk MPKs, conducted anti-submarine training in the Barents Sea. The exercise involved Il-38 anti-submarine aircraft and a nuclear submarine, simulating a real-world scenario. The crews of small anti-submarine ships practiced using anti-submarine weapon systems against a simulated underwater target.
original:
The Northern Fleet command and control unit, consisting of the Brest and Snezhnogorsk MPKs, conducted training in the Barents Sea to search for submarines.

The training took place in cooperation with Il-38 anti-submarine aircraft of the Northern Fleet mixed aviation corps.

The exercise took place in a bilateral format - the anti-submarine sailors were opposed by the crew of one of the nuclear submarines of the Northern Fleet.

During the exercise, the crews of small anti-submarine ships will also conduct a series of joint training on the practical use of anti-submarine weapon systems against a simulated underwater target.

The Brest and Snezhnogorsk MPKs are armed with AK-176M and AK-630M anti-aircraft artillery systems, RBU-6000 rocket launchers and 533-mm torpedo tubes, as well as modern sonar systems. Designed to search, track and destroy submarines in the near sea and coastal zone.

Press service of the Northern Fleet#brest#Snezhnogorsk#plo#sf#northernfleet#combat training#anti-submarine aviation#naval aviation

description: The Kyiv Patrol Police received 11 BMW motorcycles as aid from the Free Land of Bavaria. The motorcycles are equipped with necessary gear for patrolling streets, enabling officers to respond quickly to calls and be more mobile.

The obtained equipment will help the capital's patrol officers to quickly respond to calls, to be more maneuverable and mobile.

I am grateful to international partners who continue to support us. Thanks to their help, we transfer the necessary machinery and equipment to the front. We equip the emergency services of the capital with modern equipment, on the operational work of which peace in the city and human lives depend.

Just last year, Bavaria handed over a 20-ton humanitarian aid truck and 6 special vehicles to Kyiv. In particular, 3 new modern "fast" Renaults, a Ford minibus, a Mercedes fire engine and an Iveco car. These cars are already working in the services of the capital.

description: Tank commander Leshy, with over 200 combat missions, led his crew in destroying a heavily fortified Ukrainian Armed Forces stronghold. They successfully dismantled the platoon stronghold, folded the bridge, and hit all machine-gun firing points, allowing infantrymen to advance.
original:
“The best reward is when the brothers are alive and well.” A tank commander with the call sign “Leshy” volunteered to defend the Motherland. The officer notes that he could not stand aside when the Fatherland was in danger, and came to the North Military District zone to fulfill his duty.
 
The tank crew under the command of “Leshy” has about 200 combat missions under his belt. Recently, he and his comrades destroyed a large fortified area of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. “It was a big pain - a very good fortified area. They couldn’t approach it for a long time, because they were always attacked by kamikaze drones on the way. We chose such a moment - we left at dawn, the sun had already risen, and we began to work,” said the tank commander. As the serviceman notes, this Ukrainian Armed Forces stronghold was heavily fortified. The enemy chose successful machine-gun points. However, this did not prevent our tank crews from completing their combat mission. “We rolled out with our crew. They worked very accurately. We dismantled the platoon stronghold, folded the bridge, and hit all the machine-gun firing points. After that, our infantrymen advanced very well,” recalls “Leshy.” For the courage and professionalism shown in battle, the tanker was awarded the medal “For Courage,” but the serviceman himself admits that the best reward is “when the brothers are alive and well.” Russian Ministry of Defense

It is clarified that after identifying the Russian aircraft, the Italian Air Force fighters returned to the base.

description: The Russian Academy of Sciences hosted the All-Russian conference 'Science, Innovation and Intellectual Property in the Context of Digital Challenges', gathering over 200 experts to discuss the formation of Russia's intellectual property market, patenting, and commercialization of intellectual property, as well as state policy directions for scientific and technological development.
original: The implementation and commercialization of intellectual property results were discussed in Moscow. The All-Russian conference “Science, Innovation and Intellectual Property in the Context of Digital Challenges”, held at the Russian Academy of Sciences, brought together more than 200 experts in the field of intellectual property.💬“The key issue for us is the formation of the intellectual property market in Russia . Without resolving this issue, it is not possible to create an effective national innovation system, where the end result should be a competitive product,” said Academician Evgeniy Kablov, Deputy President of the Russian Academy of Sciences, in his welcoming speech to the participants. He emphasized that it is necessary to ensure the interconnection of fundamental and exploratory scientific research with specific results scientific and technical activities within the framework of state programs, national and federal projects and public policy priorities. Conference participants discussed patenting and commercialization of intellectual property, directions of state policy in the field of scientific and technological development and other topics.📍The organizers of the event were the Russian Academy of Sciences, the Association of State Scientific centers "Science", Publishing House "Intellectual Property", Russian Professorial Assembly, Russian Center for the Circulation of Rights to the Results of Creative Activity, Russian Research Institute of Economics, Politics and Law in the Scientific and Technical Sphere, Moscow University. description: In Yakutia, mothers who have made significant contributions to raising children and contributing to the region's high birth rate are being recognized with awards. The 'Mother Heroine' award comes with a 1 million ruble cash prize, while the 'Sign of Highest Gratitude to the Mother' award includes a piece of jewelry with precious stones and an additional 100 thousand rubles.
original:
🤰Motherhood of many children is also a feat: mothers - heroines of Yakutia receive awards. Today, the republic has recorded the largest number of large families in the Far East. And this is thanks to mothers who take on the responsibility of raising the new generation, which, in turn, led the region to 1st place in the Far Eastern Federal District and 8th in the country in terms of birth rate. Since the establishment of the “Mother Heroine” award and sign “In Yakutia, 31 women were awarded it. Last year there were three.

The award is accompanied by a one-time cash reward in the amount of 1 million rubles.🎖There is another award for mothers: A sign of the highest gratitude to the Mother.

It is awarded to those women who have special merits in raising children, active citizenship, make a great contribution to the life of the republic, and also conduct social activities. Three such Yakut women are chosen annually. The sign itself is a piece of jewelry with precious stones. And in addition to this, women receive another 100 thousand rubles. Note that the high birth rate in the republic is due to a number of federal and regional measures to support motherhood and childhood. Only over the last 5 years, the amount of funding in the republic has increased more than 8 times. And this gives women confidence that they can raise and raise as many children as they want.

event: Taliban Resumes Stoning Women to Death
description: The Taliban regime has ordered the resumption of publicly stoning women to death for adultery, citing Islamic sharia law. The regime's leader, Haibatullah Akhundzada, dismissed international criticism, stating that women's rights advocated by the West contradict the Taliban's harsh interpretation of sharia.
original:
“Taliban order to resume stoning women to death has been met with horror”: The Taliban have vowed to publicly stone women for adultery.

“You can call it a violation of women's rights when we publicly stone them to death for committing adultery because it goes against your democratic principles. But I represent Allah, and you represent Satan,” commented the head of the Taliban regime, Haibatullah Akhundzada, on this decision. In addition to stoning women, the country also intends to return to the practice of public flogging.
Akhundzada said women's rights advocated by the international community contradict the Taliban's harsh interpretation of Islamic sharia. “Do women want the rights that Westerners talk about? We will fight the West for more than 20 years,” he noted.”

A horse wakes up More precisely - a Russian talking mare. He says that after May 20 that's all. They occupy us completely. Well, at least it hints.

All this is part of one whole. In addition to similar statements by top Russian officials, it was widely reported that Zaporizhzhia should be surrendered. In order not to create Mariupol from it.
All this against the background (rather background) of rocket fire and bombing of border areas.
All this is simultaneously a change in the phase of the war to a more inhumane one on the one hand, and simply increased informational pressure on the other. What can happen next? There is only one option. Missile attacks combined with no final result will expire, and the rhetoric will subside a little. Against the background of the beginning of the draft / mobilization, the information about "packing the military commissariat in a bus" - it will be a bit out of our hands. Option two. Missile attacks will end, the bombing of the border will intensify in order to support belligerent and intimidating rhetoric. The result. All this will have no effect on the front line. Any. Therefore, be patient, take a deep breath and do not pay attention to the Russians and a la Shariivshchyna.

And everything will be fine. I say exactly.

event: Profile Committee Completes Consideration of Mobilization Law Amendments
description: The Profile Committee of the Verkhovna Rada has finished reviewing amendments to the draft law on mobilization. The law is expected to be presented to the parliament for consideration next week, with further committee amendments to be worked out regarding conscript motivation and demobilization.
original:
Forwarded from: ZAPORIZKA JAN
✅The Profile Committee of the Verkhovna Rada has completed consideration of amendments to the draft law on mobilization

As early as next week, the law can go to the hall for consideration by the parliament, - said committee member Vadym Ivchenko.

A total of 4,269 amendments were considered. Next week, further committee amendments will be worked out regarding the motivation of conscripts, as well as demobilization.

What are the main transformations experienced by the draft law on mobilization: the proposal regarding the review of people with disabilities of 2-3 groups, who received it until February 24, 2022, was not supported. ) without confirming the existence of such people on the military register. the amendment, which provided for the demobilization of the military after 36 months of service without a special decision of the Staff of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief, was rejected; the right to mobilize 18-year-olds to the army was not supported, until they reach the mobilization age they can join the army only voluntarily ;rules on limiting the rights of evaders, namely the blocking of bank accounts, have been deleted. Restrictions on the right to drive vehicles have been left.

Approximately on April 10-11, the draft law will appear in the parliament hall after consideration in the committees and will be quickly voted on. But then the opposition can introduce a "blocking resolution" that will delay the signing of the approved law, and in the end it will be signed at the end of April or the beginning of May, and in another month the law will start working, - according to the deputies.

description: A third-grader lost 97,000 rubles to scammers in the game Roblox after sharing a photo of her parents' bank card. The scammers also helped her get a loan for 300,000 rubles, which was later canceled due to suspicious activity.
original:
A third-grader lost 97k of her parents' rubles to scammers - all for virtual money in the game Roblox. In addition, with the help of a female gamer, the scammers managed to get a loan for 300k.

The schoolgirl’s mother said that her daughter really likes to hang out in the popular game and communicate with other gamers in a special chat on Telegram. It was there that she fell for the scammers who promised to send him mountains of virtual currency. To do this, the girl needed to send a photo of her parents’ bank card, which she did. And the pockets of the crooks were replenished by 97k.

This was not enough for them - the scammers helped the girl get a loan for 300k in one bank and credit cards in two others. Fortunately, the loan was canceled due to suspicious manipulations. The schoolgirl's mother noted that her daughter was treated well - she understood that something bad was happening, but she could not stop.

description: The Yeniden Refah Partisi party is gaining popularity, potentially hindering the victory of Erdogan's candidate in the upcoming elections. The party's growth is attributed to dissatisfaction among voters, particularly conservative and religiously-minded individuals, who are considering voting for Yeniden Refah Partisi in protest.
original:
The biggest spoiler for Murat Kurum now is the representatives of the Yeniden Refah Partisi party. Given the growing popularity of this party, they greatly hinder the victory of Erdogan’s candidate.

Today, the Yeni Şafak newspaper published an article on this topic entitled “Time to show gratitude to the man who made Hagia Sophia a mosque again” / Ayasofya’yı açan adama vefa zamanı. And here's what columnist Aydin Unal writes (summarized translation): Most voters take a practical approach to elections, analyzing and deciding which party will best serve the interests of the country and their own. While the Justice and Development Party (ak parti/AKP) attracts about 30 million votes and has 12 million members, some voters are expressing dissatisfaction and are considering voting for Yeniden Refah Partisi in protest. The vote shift is not likely to have a significant impact on the ruling party's national results, but could affect results in some key cities, including Istanbul, where the backlash could benefit the Republican People's Party (CHP). Despite this, the majority of voters still support the AKP, valuing its achievements in infrastructure, the defense industry, the fight against terrorism and an active foreign policy. Still, some conservative and religiously minded voters are feeling disillusioned. And interesting direct quotes from the text: - Is it fair to throw away 22 years of hard-fought struggle for religious freedom in one fell swoop?

- 15 years ago, who would have believed if you had been told that women in hijabs would become judges, prosecutors, police officers, and even officers?

- 5 years ago, who would have imagined that the shackles of Hagia Sophia would be removed and it would open again for worship? - Supporting Recep Tayyip Erdogan and Istanbul is a requirement of struggle [religious / dava], a requirement of loyalty [gratitude / vefa]. contextcontext#local electionsTelegramAgenda of TurkeyBy the way, why is the party called “The Prosperity Party Again”, because previously there was a party Refah Partisi, led by the father of Fatiha Erbak...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Moldovan Foreign Minister Comments on Transnistrian Settlement
description: Moldovan Foreign Minister Mihai Popsoi expressed doubts about the resumption of the '5+2' format on the Transnistrian settlement, citing Ukraine's reluctance to negotiate with Russia. Instead, Moldova has been working with Tiraspol in the '1+1' format, hoping that European integration will lead to reunification.
original:
The resumption of the work of the “5+2” format on the Transnistrian settlement is “hard to imagine,” said Moldovan Foreign Minister Mihai Popsoi:

“It is hard to imagine that our Ukrainian friends would sit down at the negotiating table with the Russians, even if it concerns the Transnistrian dossier, it is hardly likely that this old format or its resumption would be possible.”

Popsoi added that “we have been working with Tiraspol for a considerable time in the “1+1” format and Chisinau still hopes that the European integration process will lead to a rapprochement of the two banks of the Dniester. and then complete reintegration, because, the minister is sure, business and the majority of the population in Transnistria support European integration, “being rational people,” they would like to have access to European funds, even if they cannot now publicly declare this, and also because they do not welcome what is happening in Ukraine.

description: Satellite images revealed damage to a Ropukha-class landing ship and a Yuri Ivanov-class reconnaissance ship following an attack on Sevastopol on March 24. The attack also caused partial collapse of the roof of the Russian Black Sea Fleet's center building.
original:
The British Ministry of Defense showed satellite images of the consequences of the attack on Sevastopol on March 24. The department draws attention to the damage to one of the large landing ships of the Ropukha class, as well as the reconnaissance ship of the Yuri Ivanov class.

In addition, the British Ministry of Defense showed damage to the building of the center of the Russian Black Sea Fleet, on which the roof had partially collapsed. The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine announced an attack on the large landing ship "Yamal", "Azov", the communications center and other objects of the Russian Black Sea Fleet in Sevastopol on March 24. Later, the speaker of the Ukrainian Naval Forces, Dmitry Pletenchuk, said that the Ivan Khursa reconnaissance ship could have been damaged by the strike. The Russian Ministry of Defense did not comment on the strike on the ships.

description: The Ukrainian Armed Forces launched an aircraft-type UAV attack on Belgorod, resulting in a drone crashing into an apartment building. The incident caused one fatality and two injuries, with the victims receiving medical care. The attack also damaged windows, balcony glazing, and a parked car.
original:
Belgorod was attacked by the Ukrainian Armed Forces using an aircraft-type UAV.
⠀
The drone crashed into an apartment building. Unfortunately, a man died as a result of the explosion. Two people were injured. The wife of the deceased man received a closed head injury, lacerations to the face and a superficial burn to the thigh. Woman ambulance crew
Show more
transported to the regional clinical hospital. Another resident independently went to city hospital No. 2 - the man had a shrapnel wound in the lumbar region. Both victims are provided with all necessary medical care.
⠀
According to preliminary data, windows and balcony glazing in five apartments were damaged. A car parked next to the house was also damaged.
⠀

description: A farewell ceremony was held in Tver for the military pilots who died in the Il-76 aircraft crash in the Ivanovo region. The crew, known for their professionalism and courage, heroically fought to save the aircraft and its occupants, diverting the plane from residential buildings and preventing civilian casualties.
original:
The farewell ceremony for Tver military pilots, members of the crew of the Il-76 aircraft, which crashed in the Ivanovo region, took place in Tver. "The crew is one of the most professional, I know this firsthand, because I myself performed tasks with them for many years, we flew around almost the whole world. The commander is one of the most competent and prepared," said Deputy Commander of Military Transport Aviation Ivan Zolotko. As the head of the region emphasized, the pilots showed the highest professionalism and courage, heroically fought to save the aircraft and everyone in it. The crew managed, at the cost of their lives, to divert the falling plane from residential buildings and prevent the death of people on the ground.

Military personnel, government officials, public organizations, and residents of the Tver region came to say goodbye to the dead. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Residents of the Grayvoronsky district, including those from the villages of Kozinka and Golovchino, have been affected by regular shelling from the Ukrainian Armed Forces. The attacks have left some without gas and water, and have caused fear and concern for the safety of children and loved ones.
original:
The Belgorod region is regularly shelled: how do residents of the Grayvoronsky district who escaped from attacks by the Ukrainian Armed Forces live? A resident of the village of Kozinka, Belgorod region, told military correspondent Valentin Gorshenin that she moved in with her sister along with her child and an old grandmother, who was left without gas and water after the Ukrainian attacks.

However, in the village of Golovchino, Grayvoronsky district, they were overtaken by shelling from the Ukrainian Armed Forces. “It’s scary because everything is exploding. We woke up at seven in the morning to the sound of fragments flying. Naturally, we worry about the children, ourselves, and loved ones,” says the girl. (RT will help her find a new place and settle down.) The Ukrainian border is located at a distance of 8-10 km. But not all locals are going to leave their homes - some are ready to stay until the end.

"RT in Russian"

Statement by the head of the press center of the Center group
The Center group of troops continues to carry out combat missions in the special military operation zone.
Artillery fire and air strikes caused fire damage
Show more
on about 300 identified enemy targets, including 36 strong points, about 80 field artillery positions. During the counter-battery fight, two M777 howitzers and two D-30 were destroyed.
The Ukrainian Armed Forces' losses amounted to up to 100 military personnel, three tanks, including American-made Abrams, two infantry fighting vehicles, nine vehicles, and two unmanned aircraft control posts.

We visited St. Isaac's Cathedral and the exhibition "Hero City - Leningrad", saw the Peter and Paul Fortress and the legendary cruiser "Aurora", and also watched a hockey match between the SKA and Avtomobilist teams at the SKA Arena.

description: A new traffic management scheme will be implemented at the 5th kilometer of the Balaklava highway in Sevastopol, aiming to streamline traffic and improve safety for the 60-70 thousand daily passengers. The scheme includes dividing the territory into traffic lanes and parking zones, separating passenger pick-up and drop-off points, and creating new pedestrian crossings.
original:
Forwarded from: RaZVozhaev
On the 5th kilometer of the Balaklava highway, a new traffic management scheme will begin to work tomorrow. It was discussed today at a Government meeting. The 5th kilometer is the largest transport hub in Sevastopol. Every day there are from 60 to 70 thousand passengers; routes from different parts of the city intersect here, and there is a parking lot for buses and trolleybuses. These are huge flows of people and cars. It has long been necessary to streamline traffic here, to make it as safe as possible for everyone. Therefore, on my instructions, the State Institution “Directorate for the Development of Road Transport Infrastructure” has prepared a new traffic management scheme. The diagram is attached to this post. What's new: ▫️the territory was divided into traffic lanes and inter-flight parking zones so that there would be no collapse. Where necessary, we moved the contact network;▫️passenger pick-up and drop-off points were divided by type of transport and route directions;▫️organized 3 new passenger pick-up and drop-off platforms;▫️set up a dedicated lane for transit transport from the city to Kalfa;▫️created new pedestrian crossings; ▫️markings were applied, road signs and navigation for passengers were installed. What are the advantages:▫️it will become more convenient to navigate 5 km;▫️for passengers, the need to cross the roadway is reduced - which means traffic becomes safer;▫️redistribution of transport and passenger flows reduces the time of transfer from one route to another. Over the next two weeks, employees of the State Unitary Enterprise Sevelektroavtotrans will be on duty at the transport hub, who will help passengers find their way around the place. Specialists will also analyze feedback from passengers and make adjustments if necessary.

description: The 5th Cossack reconnaissance brigade 'Terek' established the 'Archangel' UAV unit to conduct combat missions using unmanned aerial vehicles on the combat contact line. The unit is staffed by highly qualified UAV pilots who are undergoing combat coordination and training in military field conditions.

Taking into account the specifics of modern military conflicts, the command of the 5th Cossack reconnaissance brigade “Terek” decided to create the “Archangel” UAV unit. This unit will carry out assigned combat missions using unmanned aerial vehicles on the line of combat contact. A start!
Highly qualified UAV pilots have entered into volunteer contracts and are currently undergoing combat coordination and training in military field conditions. Entrepreneurs did not stand aside either, who, together with the charitable foundation for assistance to military personnel of the Stavropol Territory, the Kazachek society in the village of Nadezhda, collected and brought the equipment necessary for the effective operation of the unit: drones, electronic warfare stations, walkie-talkies, camouflage networks, operator equipment, consumables for them, repeaters, 3D products for the manufacture of BC. The first results will be out soon! To the guys, strength of spirit, health and success! https://t.me/argangelTerek

event: US Authorities Request Companies to Stop Supplying Goods
description: US authorities have asked over 20 American companies to voluntarily stop supplying goods to over 600 foreign partners, fearing diversion to Russia and potential use in the northwestern military district of Ukraine. The goods in question are components for Russian missiles and drones found in the war zone.
original:
Forwarded from: NETASS
US authorities are asking American companies to stop supplying goods to more than 600 foreign partners, fearing that the products will end up in Russia and be used in the northwestern military district of Ukraine, reports Reuters.
 
“Over the past few weeks, we have sent letters to over 20 US companies, each containing a list of over 600 foreign parties. In these letters, we asked US companies to voluntarily stop supplying these parties due to the high risk of diversion to Russia,” US Assistant Secretary of Commerce Matthew Axelrod said at a conference on export controls in Washington.
 
Axelrod added that the US Department of Commerce, State Department and Treasury are in direct contact with the management of a number of American companies to discuss further steps to prevent their products from entering Russia. According to Reuters, the companies in question produce goods that served as components for Russian missiles and drones found in the war zone in Ukraine.NETASS

description: Quincy Promes, the leader of Spartak, was imprisoned in Al-Awir, UAE, due to his involvement in a drug trafficking case. He was shaved bald and placed in a cell with dozens of people, mostly from Pakistan, Egypt, and India, some of whom are drug addicts. Promes hopes to return to Russia and avoid being sent to the Netherlands, where he was sentenced to 6 years in prison.
original:
Quincy Promes changed his image in prison in the UAE because of the bosses of the correctional facility. The leader of Spartak was shaved bald and placed in a cell with dozens of people huddled on the floor.

Promes is in a prison in the city of Al-Awir, which has very strict rules: upon admission, everyone is shaved bald. Those who decide to grow their hair will face punishment: they may be prohibited from calling loved ones or watching TV. There have been no visits in prison since 2020, following the coronavirus pandemic. As the day progresses, the player is allowed to leave his cell to watch TV. He can exercise three times a week. Promes sleeps on one of three bunk beds. About 20 people also live in his cell and sleep on the floor. Most of them are from Pakistan, Egypt or India, some of whom are drug addicts. The prison itself is noisy and constantly cold due to air conditioning.

The footballer hopes that he will be able to return to Russia, and will not be sent to the Netherlands, where the court sentenced Promes to 6 years in prison for involvement in the importation of a total of more than 1.3 tons of cocaine through the port of Antwerp and 1.5 years for causing bodily harm. In Russia, ex-star of “House-2” Maria Kuleshova may be waiting for him, who hinted that she became pregnant from the star of “Spartak”. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

event: Meeting of Commission for Material Assistance
description: A meeting of the commission for providing material assistance in monetary terms was held in Gorlovka's Tsentralno-Gorodsky district. The commission reviewed 100 applications from citizens and formed a list of recipients for April. In the first quarter, 12 meetings were held, considering 1,533 requests and approving 1,504 for a total of 7,713,000 rubles.
original:
A meeting of the commission for the provision of material assistance in monetary terms was held under the administration of the Tsentralno-Gorodsky district of the city of Gorlovka. On Friday, March 29, a meeting of the commission for the provision of material assistance in monetary terms was held at the Department of Labor and Social Protection of the Population of the administration of the Tsentralno-Gorodsky district of the city of Gorlovka.

100 applications from citizens were submitted for consideration by the commission. Based on the results of the meeting, a list of recipients of this assistance is formed for April of the current year.

In the first quarter of this year, 12 meetings of the Commission were held, at which 1,533 requests from residents of the Central City District for financial assistance were considered. The decision on the appointment was made based on 1,504 requests, incl. 23 - persons from among the evacuees, for a total amount of 7,713,000.00 rubles.

In its work, the Commission is guided by the Procedure for providing financial assistance in monetary terms to certain categories of persons, approved by order of the head of the Donetsk People's Republic No. 164 dated June 12, 2019. The decision of the commission is made by voting and recorded in the minutes of the meetings.

For detailed information on payment, you must contact the Department of Labor and Social Protection of the Population.

description: Ukrainian refugees return from abroad due to various reasons, including emotional factors. Half of them return to settlements where they do not always feel safe. The main motivations for returning home include reuniting with relatives, homesickness, returning to pre-war workplaces, and accessing medical care.
original:
Forwarded from: Diaspora - Ukrainians in Europe🇺🇦🇪🇺
Why do Ukrainian refugees return from abroad. Ukrainian refugees return from abroad for various reasons. Most often, it is emotional, but there are also other important factors.

Half of people return from abroad to settlements where they do not always feel safe (53%). Among the factors that motivated them to return home, the following are named: ▪️desire to reunite with their relatives - 49%▪️homesickness - 35%▪️return to the pre-war workplace - 15%▪️impossibility to find a job - 11%▪️sense of security - 11%▪️lack of housing abroad - 9%▪️attending school in Ukraine -7%▪️access to medical care -6%
 
Most (82%) of the refugees returned to the regions where they lived before the war. 90% of them returned to their own homes.

Among those who returned to Ukraine, women made up 39%, children under 17 years old - 35%, men - 19%. In Poland, the highest percentage of people who returned to Ukraine - 49% of respondents. Similar indicators of return in Romania (46% returned), Moldova (43% returned), Slovakia (40% returned). From Germany, only 13% of all refugees returned to Ukraine, from the Czech Republic - 17%. Most often, refugees with lower incomes and those living in temporary housing decide to return. 🌐DIASPORA

event: Restoration of Stele at Entrance to Donetsk Region
description: Soldiers of a division restored the foundation near the ceiling, cleaned the area, and welded and painted metal poles for flags at the stele at the entrance to the Donetsk region. The stele, featuring Ukrainian national elements, symbolizes the indomitable spirit of Ukrainian defenders in the east of the country.
original:
Special flags fluttered near the stele at the entrance to the Donetsk region.

They are very valuable because there are special words, colors and signs on them. The flags of those brigades, battalions and units of the Defense Forces, which heroically defend Donetsk region from the Russian occupier and give a worthy rebuff to bloodthirsty enemies, are mounted on metal poles.

Stela at the entrance to the Donetsk region
has a Ukrainian national element - mosaic embroidery and details unique to this region.
For example, the Coat of Arms: a blue palm in a golden field on a black curved base. The shield is crowned by a golden stylized crown of chestnut leaves, and frames a wreath of green oak branches, wrapped in a purple ribbon with the motto: "Possibility proved in action."

Back in 1896, the blacksmith Oleksiy Mertsalov made a palm tree from a railway rail. "Palma Mertsalova" indicates the economic potential of the region, which is connected with coal, etc. And the yellow color represents the hot steppe climate.
On the letters on the ceiling, you can see many inscriptions and blue and yellow ribbons. These are personal autographs of fighters and even messages to the aggressor who was going in the direction where the Russian ship was sent...

Most of the military, volunteers, medics, and chaplains who go to the war zone or leave there after completing their tasks, willingly take pictures here.
Soldiers of one of the divisions restored the foundation near the ceiling, cleaned the place of debris, welded and painted metal poles for flags, in short, they successfully implemented the creative project of the Central Military Commission officers and their command.

Today, the Donetsk region is at the center of the military confrontation between the Ukrainians and the Russian occupiers. Bloody battles for its territory take place every day. Therefore, the stele at the entrance to Donetsk region remains the iconic place that symbolizes the indomitable spirit of the Ukrainian defenders in the east of the country. Let the special flags be etched in the memory of future generations. Because these are the flags of our defenders, who heroically fight for the freedom of Ukrainians and for Ukraine!

Public Relations Service of the 9th Army Corps

description: Russia will host the BRICS summit in Kazan, inviting not only member states but also partners in the BRICS+ format. The association is expanding globally, with around thirty countries in line to join as 'partner countries'.
original:
Russia will invite to the summit in Kazan not only BRICS members, but also partners in the BRICS+ format. This was stated by Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov. “In parallel, a decision is being prepared for the summit to introduce a new category of “partner country.” There are about thirty states in line. The association has truly acquired a global dimension, not only in its agenda and geography, but also in the number of countries,” he noted.

Lavrov also emphasized that the regionalization of world development is now underway, when “each region, country wants to rely on its neighbors, to see what can be done among themselves, “in their own circle” so that it does not depend on logistics, financial and other instruments, still controlled by the West." In his opinion, in parallel, the planetary process will inevitably return, in which BRICS “can play a harmonizing, unifying role.”

The chairmanship of the association passed to Russia in January and will last until the end of this year. It includes more than 200 events, operated by the Roscongress Foundation. The key event will be the summit of the heads of state of the BRICS member states.@roscongressPhoto: Russian Foreign Ministry website

description: In Solnechnogorsk, Moscow region, two children got stuck in a swamp in the city center due to rapid snowmelt and heavy equipment work. Adults rescued them, with one child being pulled out by passers-by and the other by Ministry of Emergency Situations rescuers.
original:
Forwarded from: 112
In the Moscow region, adults rescued two children from a swamp in the city center.

No, we're not kidding. This is Solnechnogorsk. Due to the rapid melting of snow, the complete absence of any working rainfall and the work of heavy equipment, what is shown in the video was formed in the square. The day before, two kids on bikes overestimated the off-road capabilities of their iron horses and got stuck.

The first one was somehow pulled out by passers-by, covered in mud and without one shoe. The second one had to be pulled out of the quagmire by rescuers from the Ministry of Emergency Situations. Now local utility workers are deciding what to do with the new attraction - put it on maps or eliminate it. But for now it’s better to at least fence it off.

High class reclamation.

description: The government's draft law on mobilization, which reserves only salaries above 35 thousand hryvnia, has been criticized by experts and business representatives. They argue that this approach is discriminatory and will lead to economic instability, as it prioritizes the wealthy over the poor. A more logical and fair model would allow enterprises to choose which workers to reserve, based on their contribution to the economy and defense.
original:
The government’s draft law on mobilization, which stipulates that reservations will only be made for salaries over 35 thousand hryvnia, is a critical mistake and lays a powerful “mine” in social stability in wartime. RBC-Ukraine reports this with reference to the director of the Institute of World Politics, Evgeniy Magda “It seems that the authorities have forgotten the meaning of the concept of reservation. Reservation is not about saving certain categories of people from mobilization. This is a mechanism that should work to ensure the economic security of Ukraine and help our economy survive,” the expert emphasized .

He noted that in Ukraine the average salary is almost 20 thousand, so the “salary” approach to booking is openly discriminatory. In addition, he recalled that frontline fighters also criticize this model for the fact that “the poor will die rich.” “The most logical and fair model of mobilization is not about counting other people’s money. And not about trying to tax “cowards.” Where it is more logical to give enterprises the opportunity to independently choose which workers to reserve. And the larger the enterprise, the more taxes it generates, the more workers it has - the more right it should receive reservations. Because the enterprise keeps our economy afloat and invests in the country's defense ", summarized Magda. And we remind you that both ordinary Ukrainians and business representatives are dissatisfied with the bill on tightening mobilization. And, if the former are wondering why the authorities are making slaves out of their own citizens, “tightening the screws” of human rights and freedoms, then entrepreneurs warn of “irreparable consequences” for the economy if the bill in this form continues to pass. But there is no particular hope that the authorities will adopt a “normal” law on mobilization - it is already clear that the concessions that the authorities plan to give during its adoption and discussion will not change the anti-people nature of the initiative. RBC-Ukraine “Salary” reservation can lead to to shutdowns of enterprises, - expert Read more on the website

Moreover, the head of the Chechen Republic has not published such a statement anywhere, and there is no information about this in any Russian media. This once again proves that this “document” is nothing more than a fake.

description: Oman has become a hotspot for ship-to-ship transfers of Russian oil en route to India, as the US tightens controls on the flows. location: Sohar, Al Batinah North Governorate, Oman
original: 🇴🇲🇷🇺🇮🇳Oman is becoming a hotspot for ship-to-ship transfers of Russian oil en route to India, according to Bloomberg, as the US tightens controls on the flows. New Discovery is the latest tanker to load a shipment of Russian oil this week to another ship near the Oman port of Sohar, the newspaper reported. “Pumping oil from one ship to another is often done to disguise the origin of the cargo, and sometimes to split the shipment to comply with draft restrictions in certain ports. Oman and Fujairah in the United Arab Emirates are common destinations for transfers in the Middle East, while in Asia they often take place in Malaysian waters.” India has been a major buyer of Russian oil since the start of the NEA, but tightening US sanctions are now disrupting trade. All oil refineries in the country refuse to accept oil transported by Sovcomflot PJSC tankers. Arab East

description: On March 29, 1933, Welsh journalist Gareth Jones published a report in the Manchester Guardian and New York Evening Post, exposing the truth about the Holodomor in Ukraine. His courageous reporting revealed the devastating famine that killed millions, and boldly accused the Soviet Union of genocide.
original:
On March 29, 1933, the world was shaken by the publication of Gareth Jones, a Welsh journalist who became one of the first Western correspondents to reveal the truth about the Holodomor in Ukraine.

"I passed through many villages and twelve collective farms. Everywhere I heard the cry: "We have no bread. We are dying!" Most officials deny the existence of any hunger, but a few minutes after one such denial on the train, I dared to throw a piece of stale bread on the floor. Like a bullet, the peasant threw himself on the floor and swallowed it. The same happened with the orange peel ..."

His report, printed in the "Manchester Guardian" and "New York Evening Post", described the terrible pictures of the famine that killed millions of people. Jones boldly announced the genocide that the Soviet Union was trying to hide from the world.

The courage of Gareth Jones forever engraved his name in the history of Ukraine. His reporting became one of the key factors that drew the world's attention to the Holodomor tragedy.

We recommend the film for viewing: "GARRETT JONES", 2019.

event: UAV Breaches NATO Air Defense in Romania
description: A UAV successfully evaded NATO air defense in Romania, with fragments found on agricultural land near Brail. The drone's flight path took it through multiple air defense areas, including a newly created one in the Danube Delta. The incident is expected to prompt Romania to demand strengthened NATO air defense on the eastern flank, leading to the transfer of additional air defense systems and radars.
original:
03.29.24. A note from the channel “Two Majors”.
“NATO air defense in Romania turned out to be useless against UAVs
According to the statement of the Romanian Ministry of Defense, on March 28, 2024, on a plot of agricultural land in the area of the Big Island near the city of Brail
Show more
fragments “probably belonging to an aerial vehicle (drone)” were discovered. The expected flight path of the UAV provides for the flight of several air defense areas, including through a newly created one in the Danube Delta specifically to counter drones attacking Ukrainian Danube ports.
Since February 2022, the SAMP-T air defense system has been deployed on the Black Sea coast of Romania at the Capu Midia military base as part of the Eagle mission of the French Armed Forces. Patriot air defense systems of the Romanian Air Force are based in the same area.
Let the Romanian and NATO generals puzzle over how the drone managed to fly past the air defense position area. At the same time, this incident is expected to serve as a reason for Romania’s demand to strengthen the NATO air defense system on the eastern flank, which will soon entail the transfer of additional air defense systems and radars to this direction.”

According to the head of the “Officers of Russia” department, Artur Malivanchuk, Myasnikov received three bullet wounds during the attack. The soldier was on the list of wounded in Crocus City Hall, which was posted by the Ministry of Emergency Situations. They plan to bury Myasnikov on March 29.

As Malivanchuk said, the colonel served in the third special forces brigade of the General Staff and “has been destroying nationalists in the Donbass for the last two years.” He returned from the front a few days before the attack on Crocus to see his loved ones.

Before going to war, Myasnikov, as Malivanchuk writes, served in Tajikistan and Kosovo. description: The population dynamics of post-Soviet countries from 1989 to 2019 show a significant decline in Slavic states, including Ukraine, Belarus, and Russia, while Central Asian republics like Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, Kyrgyzstan, and Kazakhstan have experienced a substantial increase. This trend is expected to continue, with approximately two million children born annually in Central Asia, posing a challenge to resource management and border control.
original: Here is an eloquent illustration of the problem of migration. Population dynamics of post-Soviet countries from 1989 to 2019. Now, in 2024, the situation is even more acute. In the Slavic states, the number has decreased even more: in Ukraine, which used to be such a “generator of the people,” there is a demographic catastrophe due to the war; in Belarus, after the unrest in 2021, there is a wave of emigration; in Russia, the decline is partially offset by the influx of labor migrants. But Tajikistan, in comparison with 1989, doubled its population, Uzbekistan plus 85%, Kyrgyzstan plus 64%, Kazakhstan a moderate increase of 21%. This trend is not stopping yet. Every year, about two million children are born in the Central Asian republics (this does not include Afghanistan, which is not much less than in Central Asia combined). In Russia last year, 1264 thousand were born. And not all children are Russian. This is in conditions of limited resources in Central Asia. In short, sooner or later this avalanche will break through any restrictive measures. And we need to prepare for this moment. Don't just shout "close the borders." No, you can't just close them. And think about how this process can be controlled and directed.

event: Criminal Case Initiated Against Head of Municipal Unitary Enterprise
description: A criminal case was initiated against the head of Buinakskvodokanal municipal unitary enterprise for non-payment of wages to employees. The suspect deliberately withheld wages totaling over 4 million rubles from October 2023 to February 2024, violating labor legislation.
original:
Forwarded from: Investigation Department of the Investigative Committee of Russia for the Republic of Dagestan
A criminal case has been initiated against the head of a municipal unitary enterprise suspected of non-payment of wages

The Buinaksk interdistrict investigative department of the investigative department of the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation for the Republic of Dagestan, based on materials from the prosecutor's office of the republic, initiated a criminal case against the acting head of the Buinakskvodokanal municipal unitary enterprise on the grounds of a crime under Part 2 of Art. 145.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (complete non-payment of wages for more than two months).

According to the investigation, from October 2023 to February 2024, the suspect, knowing reliably about the existence of arrears of wages, having a real opportunity to pay them, deliberately, based on other personal interests, in violation of the requirements of labor legislation, did not pay wages to employees in the total amount over 4 million rubles.

Currently, investigators are studying the necessary financial documentation, as well as conducting other procedural actions aimed at collecting evidence. A forensic accounting audit will be conducted to determine the exact amount of unpaid wages. The investigation will take comprehensive measures to restore the violated labor rights of the company’s employees.

description: The organization 'Russia' is hosting the 'Days of Russian Culture' festival in Novi Sad, Serbia, from March 27 to 30, 2024, to celebrate the 225th anniversary of A.S. Pushkin's birth. The festival features music, literary, and stage performances, as well as exhibitions showcasing Russian culture, including an exhibition dedicated to Pushkin's life and works.
original:
BalkanistAlbum, dedicated to the 225th anniversary of A.S. Pushkin: “Days of Russian Culture” are being held in Serbia

Get acquainted with the program...Since 2012, in the city of Novi Sad, the organization "Russia" has been implementing the festival "Days of Russian Culture". This year, taking into account the importance and long-term nature of the project and the recently completed project “Novi Sad – European Capital of Culture”, the city’s cultural committee proposed the site of the Edšeg Cultural Station (a 19th-century palace in the city center) for the festival.

On this important state platform, from March 27 to March 30, 2024, the organization “Russia”, together with other organizations of the Russian diaspora of Vojvodina and Serbia, representatives of the Russian national community of Serbia, the National Council of the Russian Ethnic Minority and the Russian House, represents Russian culture through works of music, literary and stage creativity, as well as an exhibition dedicated to the significant anniversary (225th anniversary of the birth of A.S. Pushkin) “The Sun of Russian Poetry: Pushkin in the Fates of the Russian Emigration of the Kingdom of Yugoslavia”, prepared on the basis of the archival and book collections of the House of Russian Abroad. . Alexander Solzhenitsyn and the Prokofiev family archive and the exhibition of traditional Russian headdresses “Russian Kokoshniki”. As part of the extensive program of “Days of Russian Culture”, a round table “The Great Russian Poet Alexander Pushkin (1899-1937): in the history and literature of Serbia and the Russian white emigration of the twentieth century” was held. The Vojvodina Archive, the Matica Serbian Library, the House of Russian Abroad named after. Alexandra Solzhenitsyn, Russian House in Belgrade, Russian Scientific Institute in Belgrade, Moscow House of Compatriots, Petrine Academy of Sciences and Arts of Russia in the Altai Republic, Alexey Borisovich Arsenyev - a recognized historiographer of Russian emigration in Serbia, representatives of the National Council of the Russian Ethnic Minority and WARS (World Association Russian-speaking women), with the participation of the Museum. A.S. Pushkin (Moscow). Based on the results of the round table, a collection of reports will be published in Russian and Serbian.@balkanist

The digging will be delayed and made more expensive by the fact that everything there is private land, much of it for agricultural use, but this has already been said, and the second point is especially interesting - “if every silo is a little bit bigger or has an extra component” , why would it be more and what kind of components? Well, in general, although these arguments absolve the military-industrial complex of guilt, the fact that he “didn’t think” about it initially hardly justifies the military. https://www.defensenews.com /industry/2024/03/28/northrop-says-air-force-design-changes-drove-higher-sentinel-icbm-cost/Defense NewsNorthrop says Air Force design changes drove higher Sentinel ICBM costThe Sentinel nuclear missile's costs have spiked 37 %, largely due to the complexity of its command and launch segment, and triggered a review process.

Today we discovered that someone broke the frame, took out the photograph and took it away in an unknown direction, thereby desecrating the memory of our comrade.

We wrote a statement to the police about the incident. We believe that there is no place for dill in Perm - and since the enemy is acting quietly, let the authorities look for him. Please help us spread the word about this case so that the problem can be resolved faster.

Andrei died in June 2023 during the attack on Marinka. He was 19 years old, he went to serve for ideological reasons.

The memorial will be restored in the near future.

event: Bundestag Experts' Assessment on NATO Involvement
description: Bundestag experts concluded that if a NATO member state unilaterally deploys ground forces in Ukraine, outside of a pre-agreed NATO operation and command structures, the alliance as a whole and other member states will not automatically become parties to the conflict.
original:
Bundestag: Sending troops to Ukraine will not make all NATO countries part of the conflict

A hypothetically possible strike by the Russian army on the troops of one of the NATO countries in Ukraine will not become the basis for a collective response by the alliance in accordance with the fifth article of its charter, the newspaper Die Zeit reports, citing Bundestag experts. “According to the estimates of the Bundestag scientific services, the deployment of ground forces in Ukraine from one NATO country is not would automatically make all other allies participants in the conflict,” the publication reports.

It is noted that Bundestag experts came to the conclusion that if a NATO member state acts unilaterally, that is, not within the framework of a pre-agreed NATO operation and outside the NATO military command structures, the alliance as a whole, nor other states of the association, do not become parties to the conflict .ZEIT ONLINEWissenschaftlicher Dienst des Bundestags: Bodentruppen in Ukraine wären laut Exp...Die Bodentruppen-Debatte sorgte für Streit zwischen Deutschland und Frankreich. Experten des Bundestags haben sich nun konkret mit dem Szenario befasst.

event: BRICS Countries Shaping New World Order
description: The BRICS countries, comprising almost half of the world's population and a significant part of the world's GDP, are driving the transformation of the world economy and shaping a new world order. They are creating new institutions, regional integration associations, and financial settlement systems, offering alternative paradigms of development on a global scale.
original:
In the context of an unprecedented growth of geopolitical risks in the world, there is a growing awareness that the old architecture of the world order is being replaced by a new configuration of international relations and regional blocs. One of the most important driving forces of this kind of transformation of the world economy is the countries of the global South, which are creating their own institutions, regional integration associations and financial settlement systems.

The leaders of these processes are the largest emerging markets, primarily the BRICS countries. Thus, in March 2022, Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov stated: “The BRICS countries, which make up almost half of the world’s population and a significant part of the world’s GDP, will be one of the backbones of the new emerging world order "In order for BRICS to become the basis for a new world order, this bloc must offer other countries of the world economy new paradigms of development on a global scale. Such directions in the new world economic architecture, the implementation of which we are already seeing, include the restart of globalization based on a new platform of countries and regions, the creation of a new institutional system for the modernization of the world economy, the creation of a new pool of reserve currencies from emerging markets, the creation of an alternative track to the Western format for the development of the world economy, the creation of new regional blocks and platforms for their coordination and development.@stepnoy_veter

event: Death of Lieutenant Colonel Dmitro Fischer
description: Lieutenant Colonel Dmitro Fischer, a Ukrainian pilot and war criminal, was killed on June 5, 2022, near Orekhov, Zaporozhye region. His remains remained unidentified for over 1.5 years until his burial in Mirgorod was announced.

The "Ghost of Kuiva" has been found. Or Operation “Liquidation” Once the commander of the squadron of the 831st Tactical Aviation Brigade, Lieutenant Colonel of the Ukrainian-Luftwaffe Dmitro Fischer, having flown an F-16, voiced a cheer for the modern sect of the American pilot: 💬I liked the car. But in terms of characteristics, of course, it is much inferior to the Su-27. Americans call it "Dog fighter" in English. We call it close-maneuverable air combat. But here the Su-27 is king.
