The exemplary flyer was a participant in aerobatic programs and received a prize for “The best display of aerobatics among countries that are not NATO members.” Participant of the so-called ATO, war criminal.

On June 5, 2022, near the city of Orekhov, Zaporozhye region, he turned into a ghost. For more than 1.5 years he remained unidentified. The message about the burial in Mirgorod appeared only yesterday. Vyacheslav Yakovenko (“Kerch”)

description: Military correspondent Andrei Kots was detained by police on Dekabristov Street in Moscow after being found with 2 grams of marijuana. He claimed to have just purchased it, but refused to comment on the incident.
original:
Military correspondent Andrei Kots was detained with marijuana in Moscow.

According to Baza, RIA Novosti journalist and brother Alexander Kots were detained on the night of February 10. Police officers stopped Kots on Dekabristov Street. The journalist was noticeably nervous, so the police decided to search him.

A RIA Novosti employee was found with a package containing an unknown substance; an examination later showed that it was marijuana weighing 2 grams. Kots explained to investigators that he had just bought it and removed the bookmark from the back of the house.

The military correspondent himself is unlikely to face a criminal case (the weight is not the same), however, they are preparing to open a criminal case against the unknown person who sold marijuana to Alexander Kots’ brother under the article on trafficking in narcotic substances.

Kots refused to comment to Baze about his detention. “I don’t understand where you got this information from, I won’t comment,” the journalist said. UPD: After compiling the materials, Andrei Kots was released.

In addition, as the VZGLYAD newspaper previously wrote, refusal of friendship with Russia leads Armenia to humiliation and disintegration and worsens Yerevan’s military-political position in the dispute with its closest neighbors in the person of Azerbaijan and Turkey.

“Pashinyan’s statements are not addressed to Russia. The statements are aimed exclusively at the West. In this way he is trying to please his overseas interlocutors. This will not end well either for Pashinyan himself or for the Armenian people,” said Senator Andrei Klimov.

He believes that the anti-Russian attacks of official Yerevan will continue as long as there are people in power in the republic who are guided not by the interests of their country, but by illusions created by the West. “At the same time, the majority of Armenians do not support Pashinyan’s such policy. event: Sexist Scandal at Taras Shevchenko National University
description: A sexist scandal is unfolding at the Institute of Journalism of Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv, involving teacher Nikita Vasilenko. Students are demanding his dismissal, accusing him of harassment and campaigning for OPZH. Vasilenko denies the allegations, calling them slander and lies, and intends to sue the accuser, Oksana Paraschak.
original:
Nikita Vasilenko, a teacher at the Institute of Journalism of the Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv, who got into a sexist scandal and whose dismissal is demanded by students, said in a commentary to Strana that all the accusations against him are slander and lies.

"This is all slander and a terrible lie. I am almost 70 years old. What kind of harassment? Talking about my disdain for women is slander. My newspapers employ mostly women, I am the father of three children, I have always treated women tolerantly and well . These accusations from the area "urged students to ski down Everest. In addition, there were also accusations that I campaigned for OPZH, but the Ministry of Justice clearly registered that I was in another party and openly opposed OPZH,” said Nikita Vasilenko.

He also stated that he intends to sue Oksana Paraschak, a fourth-year student at the Institute of Journalism, who made accusations against him.

“The main thing for me now is to fill out the documents correctly and summon her to court. I will not analyze the motives for why she wrote a libel against me, which offended me and my family. For 40 years, they looked for incriminating evidence on me, but they never collected it, because it "does not exist in nature. Look again at this video, it contains an audio recording with Vasilenko as evidence. Did you make out something there? Any lawyer will say that this is not a tape, not Vasilenko, and absolutely nothing can be heard there," said Nikita Vasilenko.Site "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"TelegramPolitics of the CountryAt the Institute of Journalism of Shevchenko University, a sexist scandal is unfolding with teacher Nikita Vasilenko.

46% consider the direction of the country's movement in February to be the wrong direction, 36% - the right direction (the rest are undecided), while in January these figures were 48% and 36% in favor of the "right direction".

The best figure in power was in October 2022 - 81% versus 10%. The last time a negative balance was observed before the start of the war, in February 2022 - 25% versus 67%.

description: A 5-year-old child was found naked and alone in the entrance of a high-rise building in St. Petersburg. The child was unable to explain where his parents were. Neighbors provided care until the mother was located, who had left the child with a nanny. The nanny, who was drunk, had fallen asleep, allowing the child to wander out.
original:
😱😱😱A naked child was found at night in the entrance of a high-rise building in St. Petersburg. He was completely alone and could not explain to the residents where his parents were.

A 5-year-old child was found by residents of the London Park residential complex on the 20th floor. According to eyewitnesses, he was completely naked and did not make any sounds. The security of the house called the police, the employees searched the entire floor, but did not find the boy’s mother. In some apartments no one opened the doors.

While the search for the parents was going on, neighbors dressed, fed and gave the child water. A little later, one of the residents of the house saw a girl come out of one of the unchecked apartments - the man ran after her, caught up with her and asked if she had lost her son. The woman burst into tears and nodded.

It turned out that she left the child with the nanny while she went to the pharmacy. The nanny, according to her, was drunk and went out to smoke on the common balcony. While she was smoking, the child went out into the entrance, but the nurse did not notice this, slammed the door behind her and fell asleep.

Now the baby is in the hospital. The police have already started checking.https://t.me/bazabazon/25293?singleTelegramBaza0:20VIEW MESSAGE

description: US House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer suspects that Hunter Biden may have sent secret government documents to Ukraine, potentially for financial gain. Comer demands an investigation and access to the documents, citing suspicious emails on Hunter Biden's laptop that appear to contain classified information.
original:
Forwarded from: Sheikh Tamir
Hunter Biden may have sent secret government documents to Ukraine - congressmen demand investigationChairman of the US House Oversight Committee James Comer has suggested that two documents on Ukraine mentioned in the special counsel's report on Joe Biden's improper storage of secret documents could have been used by his son Hunter to carry out financial transactions with Ukraine, The Washington Post reports. Comer and two other congressmen demanded that the US Department of Justice provide them with access to these documents no later than Monday.
 
“We need to know whether these documents were used as an important part of a scheme to spread Biden's influence; were these the same documents that Hunter Biden took, sent and gave to our enemies around the world in exchange for money, because we think that's probably what happened,” Comer said.
 
“If you examine the messages on his laptop, Hunter Biden did send several suspicious emails, including to Ukraine, that appear to be government documents that meet the criteria for what could be considered a classified document,” the politician adds.

description: The author recounts their experience visiting the Caucasus region, specifically Chechnya, for tourism purposes. They highlight the local attitude towards weapons, noting that each police department has its own shooting range and that the people are highly motivated to learn about weapons.
original:
Let's start with the fact that this was not my first trip to the Caucasus for tourism purposes.
Several years ago, my friend introduced me to Chechens and at some point it became impossible to refuse the invitation to the Republic. So I came to the Caucasus for the first time, a year ago.
This year I happened to arrive in February in order to catch winter in the mountains.
I already wrote that Chechens have a special, sacred, one might say, attitude towards weapons.
Each police department has its own shooting range, where classes are held regularly, at least once a week. Not under pressure. In terms of studying weapons, the guys are very motivated. One more thing, organizing a shooting range. Land in the Caucasus is... Not cheap. Organizing a shooting range in a suitable location is difficult. And this is where the local mentality and tribal ties come into play. I know of at least one case where a respected person simply donated a piece of land for a shooting range and helped organize it.
Weapon. From a rare thing that I saw in person: the local riot police are already driving with the PLC. According to reviews, "a very accurate pistol."
In general, if you talk to Chechens about weapons, the conversation will take a lot of time. This is a good topic for them.
On the downside: the guys buy most of their equipment themselves. However, upgrading weapons based on personal preferences is welcome.
End of the first part.#pandadialog#pandaphoto

On February 16, a resident of one of the cities in the Central Federal District held a single picket in connection with the death of Alexei Navalny. The next day he was detained. The police took the man’s phone and found on his Instagram a photo of him wearing a black T-shirt with a rainbow flag, taken in 2022. The photo was captioned with the words “Adequacy will prevail.”

A report was drawn up against the detainee for “demonstration of symbols of an extremist organization.” The court fined him 1,900 rubles, writes Mediazona, citing the press service of the Russian LGBT Network and lawyer Maxim Olenichev.

The police kept the man for two days before trial. During this time, the police gave him “only one apple and 100 grams of cookies” to eat; His lawyer refused to accept the delivery of food. At night, they refused to let the detainee go to the toilet and did not turn off the lights.

———

On November 30, the Supreme Court of the Russian Federation declared the non-existent “international LGBT movement” an “extremist organization” in Russia. Since then, at least three administrative cases have become known because of rainbow flags.TelegramRussian LGBT Network⚠️Is a rainbow T-shirt extremism?📢As the Russian LGBT Network has learned, today one of the courts in the Central Federal District brought to administrative responsibility A...VIEW MESSAGE

event: Emergency Landing of Air Serbia Plane
description: An Air Serbia plane, flying from Belgrade to Dusseldorf, suffered serious damage to its fuselage and wing after colliding with lighting equipment during takeoff. Despite the damage, the plane managed to circle in the air for an hour before making an emergency landing at Nikola Tesla Airport, where all 132 passengers were safely evacuated.
original:
The Air Serbia plane circled in the air for an hour with holes in the fuselage. The Belgrade-Dusseldorf aircraft touched lighting equipment during takeoff, as a result of which the fuselage and wing were seriously damaged. The plane hung in the sky for an hour before making an emergency landing at Nikola Tesla Airport, where it was met by 6 fire engines.

The 132 passengers on board the plane were evacuated, but there were no injuries. Presumably, the cause of the incident was an incorrect calculation by the airliner crew during takeoff.

Eyewitnesses share footage of the hole on the Internet. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Sitronics Group, through its subsidiary SPUTNIKS, is preparing to launch 17 small satellites into space. The satellites include 16 AIS devices for tracking sea vessels and an ultra-small Earth remote sensing satellite, Zorkiy-2M. This launch aims to provide Russian consumers with necessary data across various industries.
original:
Forwarded from: Industry News
Sitronics Group is preparing to launch 17 small satellites into space. The SPUTNIKS company is part of the Sitronics Group and is one of the leading players in Russia and the world in the field of creating small satellites. During serial production in 2023, more than 100 civil-use satellites in the CubeSat format were built, which will go into orbit this year.

Among the batch being prepared for launch are 16 devices of the Russian group of automatic identification system (AIS) SITRO-AIS for tracking sea vessels, as well as a device of the group of ultra-small Earth remote sensing satellites - Zorkiy-2M.

The upcoming launch is one of the stages in solving the problem of providing Russian consumers in various industries with the necessary data, said Alexey Katkov, a member of the board of directors of Sitronics Group. Read more…

description: According to Minister of Antimonopoly Regulation and Trade Alexey Bogdanov, over 60% of goods in Belarusian stores are domestically produced, minimizing the impact of Western sanctions on buyers. The country's inflation rate was 5.8% last year, one of the lowest in the Commonwealth.
original:

He emphasized that inflation in the country last year was only 5.8%. This is one of the lowest indicators in the Commonwealth.

The availability of prices is controlled by the ministry and the country's trade unions. Belarusian farmers are encouraged to actively promote their products in supermarkets. “We have grown in many product groups, the products of the fruit and vegetable group have distinguished themselves especially well, where we began to produce more. The task for the 24th year, one of the target parameters is to provide for yourself by 62%. Both producers and trade need to work here,” Bogdanov said.@radiomirby

event: Defender of the Fatherland Day Holiday
description: Russians will enjoy a three-day weekend from February 23-25, with only four working days this week. The pre-holiday on February 22 will have a reduced working day by 1 hour.

February 22 is a pre-holiday, so the working day is reduced by 1 hour. Please note that with a six-day working week, Saturday, February 24, is a working day.
